title: Fact check: Are heart attacks caused by bacterial infections?
description: A viral post suggests bacterial infections, particularly biofilms, may trigger heart attacks by causing inflammation and plaque rupture. Research indicates oral bacteria, like viridans group Streptococci, are found in arterial plaques of heart attack victims. Scientists are investigating how these biofilms activate and contribute to plaque destabilization and thrombus formation, potentially linking oral health to cardiovascular disease. Read more below!

The demonstration, attended by over 100,000 people, featured anti-immigrant rhetoric and speeches from far-right figures. Clashes with police resulted in numerous injuries and arrests, highlighting the event's contentious nature.

title: Emmanuel Acho blasted: Charlie Kirk row; Joe Burrow Foundation drops member
description: Emmanuel Acho is under fire for spreading inaccurate claims about Charlie Kirk in viral TikTok and YouTube videos, refusing to correct them even after backlash. At the same time, the Joe Burrow Foundation cut ties with Hamilton County Judge Ted Berry, removing him from its board over remarks following Kirk’s assassination at Utah Valley University.

Is black seed oil effective in reducing inflammation? Here's what research said
description: Emerging research suggests black seed oil, containing thymoquinone, effectively reduces joint inflammation, rivaling NSAIDs like ibuprofen. Clinical trials demonstrate pain relief and improved function in osteoarthritis patients with oral or topical application. Studies also reveal anti-inflammatory and antioxidant benefits, indicating its potential as a safe, natural pain management option.

Metaverse, AI & drones: Terrorists exploiting emerging tech; Quad's new priority
description: Despite summit uncertainties, Quad nations are actively pursuing counterterrorism efforts, including workshops addressing drone misuse and the exploitation of emerging technologies by terrorists. India acknowledges US commitment to the Quad, even amidst evolving US-China relations. The group will also launch its Ports of the Future Partnership, highlighting ongoing cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Amazon suspends engineer: Sent 'threatening' letter to CEO Andy Jassy
description: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Fans slam NFL: 'That wasn’t even a moment'; Charlie Kirk tribute at Lambeau
description: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Blake Lively shuts door: ‘She’s not obsessed’; Taylor Swift, Kelce engagement
description: Reports indicate a rift between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively, with Lively seemingly accepting the end of their long-standing friendship. Sources suggest Lively is no longer preoccupied with Swift's life, particularly her engagement to Travis Kelce. Despite past attempts at reconciliation, Swift has remained unresponsive, and Lively is now focused on her own life.

title: Caught on camera: 'I'm sorry I wasn't ready', Mark Zuckerberg tells Donald Trump,
description: At a White House dinner, Mark Zuckerberg was caught off guard when President Trump inquired about Meta's future investments. Zuckerberg, visibly flustered, committed to spending at least $600 billion by 2028, mirroring Apple's recent announcement. Other tech CEOs, including those from Google and Microsoft, also shared their substantial investment plans, primarily focused on AI and infrastructure.
